metadata.Description: Small businesses that have a limited number of employees and operate at a local or regional level.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Small businesses that have a limited number of employees and operate at a local or regional level.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Entrepreneurship focused on sustainable energy solutions and innovations.
Financial services, such as loans, savings, and insurance, provided to low-income individuals or small businesses.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises address youth unemployment by creating job opportunities and promoting entrepreneurship.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises employ local communities, contributing to local economic development and poverty reduction.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises collaborate with financial institutions to access capital and financial services for business growth.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises support women entrepreneurs by providing training, mentorship, and access to markets.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises administer microfinance programs to enable access to credit and financial resources for small businesses.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises measure their economic impact to assess their contribution to local and national economies.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises align with the sustainable development goals by promoting inclusive and sustainable economic growth.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises

relations.Description: Medium small micro enterprises are an instance of inclusive business models that prioritize social and environmental impact alongside financial returns.
relations.Subject: medium small micro enterprises
energy entrepreneurship
relations.Description: Energy entrepreneurship implements rigorous building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: energy entrepreneurship
relations.Description: Energy entrepreneurship funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: micro-finance
relations.Description: Micro-finance implements energy access programs that provide financial support for clean energy projects in underserved communities.

relations.Subject: micro-finance
relations.Description: Micro-finance focuses on addressing energy poverty by providing financial services for clean energy solutions to marginalized communities.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Start-ups are a type of medium small micro enterprise that are newly established and typically have innovative business models or products. They play a crucial role in driving economic growth and job creation.
relations.Subject: start-ups

relations.Description: Family-owned businesses are a category of medium small micro enterprises that are owned and operated by members of the same family. They often have a long-term perspective and contribute to local economies.
relations.Subject: family-owned businesses

relations.Description: Cooperatives are a type of medium small micro enterprise that are owned and democratically controlled by their members. They promote collective decision-making and equitable distribution of benefits.
relations.Subject: cooperatives

relations.Description: Social enterprises are a type of medium small micro enterprise that prioritize social or environmental objectives alongside financial sustainability. They address social issues through innovative business models.
relations.Subject: social enterprises

relations.Description: Informal businesses are a category of medium small micro enterprises that operate outside the formal legal and regulatory frameworks. They often face challenges in accessing finance and social protection.
relations.Subject: informal businesses
